abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile talks about better
            drainage and less flooding in Serbia. Serbia Irrigation and
            Drainage Rehabilitation Project reduced the chances of
            people losing their lives in floods, and cut down the risk
            of damage to land, crops, property, and infrastructure. The
            river's embankment was reinforced and heightened.
            Repairing drainage canals allowed farmers to irrigate and it
            increased the safety of those living near river beds and
            dykes. Around Serbia, more than 160,000 hectares have been
            protected from flooding, and over 300,000 people have
            directly benefitted from the project.
